alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 10:54AM CDT until May 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. .This morning`s river forecasts (Monday) take into account past precipitation that has occurred and forecast precipitation from 7 am this morning through 7 am Tuesday morning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Hawley. * WHEN...From this evening to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Parts of Hawley City Park begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 8.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
